importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The article was published on October 21, 2025, and details the current state of the gubernatorial race in New Jersey, with the election scheduled for November 2025.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The article covers developments in the 2025 New Jersey gubernatorial race, including campaign strategies, endorsements, and polling trends as of late October 2025.

keyTakeAways: The 2025 New Jersey gubernatorial race is one of the few odd-year gubernatorial elections in the U.S. and is drawing national attention due to its unexpectedly close polling results.
Democratic Rep. Mikie Sherrill, a former Navy pilot and federal prosecutor, is running against Republican Jack Ciattarelli, a pro-Trump small business owner and former state Assembly member.

Both candidates are engaging in personal attacks, with Ciattarelli blaming Sherrill for being barred from walking at her naval academy graduation in 1994, and Sherrill accusing Ciattarelli’s former medical publishing company of downplaying opioid dangers and claiming he caused tens of thousands of deaths.

Sherrill has received an endorsement from former President Barack Obama, while Ciattarelli has been endorsed by President Donald Trump, who is planning to host tele-rallies for him despite Ciattarelli having previously criticized Trump in 2016.
Affordability and rising costs of living, including a 17% to 20% surge in electricity bills in June, are central voter concerns.

Despite Democrats having a 3-to-2 voter registration advantage, New Jersey has a history of purple gubernatorial elections, with the last time a single party elected a governor for three consecutive terms being in the 1960s.
The race is being shaped by national political dynamics, including the influence of Trump’s endorsement and debates over policy, particularly on healthcare, energy, and taxes.

namedEntities.name: Mikie Sherrill
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Democratic U.S. Representative and former Navy pilot
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is the Democratic candidate running against Jack Ciattarelli in the 2025 New Jersey gubernatorial race, and her background as a former pilot and federal prosecutor is central to her campaign narrative.

namedEntities.name: Jack Ciattarelli
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Republican politician and former state Assembly member
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the Republican candidate in the 2025 New Jersey gubernatorial race, known for his pro-Trump stance and previous criticism of Donald Trump, yet currently receiving Trump’s endorsement and facing personal attacks from Sherrill.

namedEntities.name: Barack Obama
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He publicly endorsed Mikie Sherrill, calling her the 'right choice' to be governor, highlighting the role of former presidents in shaping national political narratives and voter sentiment.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former U.S. President and current political figure
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He endorsed Jack Ciattarelli and is planning tele-rallies for him, showing how national political figures influence state-level elections and contribute to polarization in the race.

namedEntities.name: Ben Dworkin
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Director of the Rowan Institute for Public Policy & Citizenship at Rowan University
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He provides expert analysis on New Jersey’s political history, noting that the state is 'decidedly purple' in gubernatorial elections despite being blue in presidential races.

namedEntities.name: Phil Murphy
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is stepping down after two terms, making this the race for his successor, and the potential for Sherrill to become the first governor from the same party in three consecutive terms since the 1960s.

namedEntities.name: New Jersey
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The state is hosting a close gubernatorial race that defies its usual blue political leanings, reflecting broader national trends in voter concerns and political polarization.

namedEntities.name: Rowan University
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is home to Ben Dworkin, who offers academic insight into the political dynamics of gubernatorial elections in New Jersey.

namedEntities.name: Camden
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is a key area where voter sentiment is being expressed, with Mayor Victor Carstarphen supporting Sherrill on housing and energy cost issues.

namedEntities.name: Cherry Hill
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is a site of a campaign event where Republican Nicole Nance expressed support for Ciattarelli’s accounting background as a solution to high property taxes.

namedEntities.name: Bedminster
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is where Donald Trump frequents his golf course, indicating his personal involvement in the campaign and the regional political influence of Trump supporters.

namedEntities.name: Naval Academy
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is the origin of the personal attack narrative involving Mikie Sherrill, who claims she was barred from walking in a graduation ceremony due to refusing to turn in classmates during a cheating scandal.

namedEntities.name: Medical publishing company (Ciattarelli’s former company)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Private company linked to Jack Ciattarelli
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is accused by Sherrill of producing materials that downplayed opioid dangers, forming a key point of controversy in the campaign.

namedEntities.name: U.S. Senate
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: New Jersey’s political alignment in presidential and Senate races is contrasted with its purple gubernatorial history, highlighting a key distinction in state-level politics.

namedEntities.name: Board of Public Utilities
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It reported a 17% to 20% surge in electricity bills in June 2025, a key issue cited by voters and candidates in the affordability debate.

namedEntities.name: MAGA movement
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Political movement associated with Donald Trump
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is a focal point of Sherrill’s campaign messaging, as she urges voters to reject Trump’s influence and warns of Ciattarelli’s alignment with that movement.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The 2025 New Jersey gubernatorial race is unexpectedly close, with Democratic congresswoman Mikie Sherrill and Republican Jack Ciattarelli competing in a historically blue state. Sherrill, a former Navy pilot and federal prosecutor, has gained support from former President Barack Obama and is criticized for being barred from walking at her naval academy graduation. Ciattarelli, a pro-Trump figure and former Assembly member, has received endorsement from President Donald Trump despite earlier criticism of him, and has faced accusations from Sherrill that he downplayed opioid risks and caused tens of thousands of deaths. Both candidates are engaging in personal attacks, with Sherrill’s campaign accusing Ciattarelli’s past business of promoting dangerous medical misinformation. The race is being shaped by national politics, voter concerns about affordability and rising utility costs (such as a 17% to 20% electricity bill increase), and the fact that New Jersey has not elected a governor from the same party for three consecutive terms since the 1960s. Despite Democrats’ voter registration advantage, the state’s history of purple gubernatorial elections suggests a competitive race with no clear frontrunner.
title: Blue New Jersey is expecting a very close race for governor this November
